content.detailedDescription: In warren, michigan, at apx. 11p.M., i stepped out onto the front porch (facing south).  watching the neighborhood fireworks, i happened to notice bright lights sitting stationary amid the fireworks.  they were in a tight, horizontal row and golden-white in color.  the middle one was slightly larger.  i could faintly make out an amber-reddish glow around the periphery of each.  it appeared to be three lights on one object. they were steady, not pulsating.  every once in a while, they would grow alittle bit brighter, then dimmer. initially, i thought it was a firework with a delayed explosion, but it never exploded.  then, i thought it was an airplane making its ascent from a nearby airport, considering how low on the horizon it was (less than 45 degrees).  but the lights were too golden, and the object was stationary.  convinced it wasn't conventional, i ran inside for 2 seconds to grab my camera-phone.  when i got back outside, the lights had dimmed to a pale orange, but the object had not moved.  i aimed my camera at it, and it suddenly tilted at an angle (diagonal) and made a rather hasty departure to the right of me (west).  it flew behind the nearby treeline, and i lost sight of it.  didn't see it again.
content.summary: Object w/three bright golden-white lights, with amber-red "aura"...Hovered for apx. 5 min. before tilting and moving sideways out of sight.

content.detailedDescription:
At 9 pm on june 24, 2009, i was sitting with a friend on the verandah of a chalet on the banks of the orange river in south africa's remote richtersveld national park. looking up at the sky, my attention was drawn to a bright yellow object moving from left to right across the night sky. i directed my friend's attention to the object and he saw it too, moving rapidly on a course parallell to the earth. i had it in vision for about 10 seconds before it changed direction and vanished into the sky. i was truly amazed to see this phenomenon, as it was the second sighting we had made at the same place within two years. the nature of this sighting was very similar to the first, which we made on an assignment in the richtersveld national park on november 21, 2007 at 10 pm and which i subsequently reported to ufoinfo.Com. the sighting made on june 24 2009 left us in absolutely no doubt that what we witnessed on both occasions was a ufo. 
the area is hundreds of kilometers from the nearest airport and remote from any towns or air traffic.
for your interest, i attach the report of the first sighting we made on november 21,2007.


location of sighting: richtersveld south africa. november 21,2007
number of witnesses: 2 
number of objects: 1 
shape of objects: oval.
 
full description of event/sighting: an author, tim o'hagan and a journalist, geoff dalglish, doing a road trip through southern africa, were staying alone at a remote bush lodge on the banks of the orange river in the richtersveld when they saw an elliptical shaped object emanating a yellow/gold light move across the sky directly within their vision at an angle of about 70 degrees. the object had a trajectory that seemed parallel to the earth and this trajectory continued for about seven seconds. the object then turned south and seemed to maintain its parallel course before disappearing entirely in a nanosecond. both parties have no explanation for this sighting which was several hundred kilometers from any airport.

i hope this information is useful to you,

kind regards

timo'hagan
content.summary: Second ufo sighting at same place in two years.

content.detailedDescription:
At 0900 pm, my son told me a star had fallen from the sky and i looked out my bedroom window and saw a silver coloured kind of metalic sphere flying quite low and above our backyard, it had some kind of halo or aura around it, it was beautiful and i just could't stop looking at it, the thought of it being an ufo did not pas through my mind at that moment i just kept thinking where are the windows..My son of 6 yrs was very happy and kept jumping up and down and pointing at it.. a few minutes later it dissapeard behind the neightbours roof, located againts our backyard.. then another ufo appeard, this time a triangle shaped one, silver coloured and metalic, no windows no doors just metalic and the sun shining reflection on it, suddenlly lights came out underneath this triangle, as of it had some kind of led lights underneath, then it left and another one showed up this time following a plane ...At this point i realised it was an ufo as it started flying around the plane. my son of 6 took my camera and made two pictures, while but it was quite far away at that moment so you would have to zoom it to see it, what you see as being white is the reflectionof the sun on the metal.

it was a clear evening, the sun shining brightly, almost no clouds, and no birds something i'm not used to see as there are always birds here flying around.
content.summary: One sphere two triangles silver metalic.

content.detailedDescription: Have been seeinga single object for last 10 months, directly overhead and would over time of each evening it would move, east to west, fling like someone was playing with a joystick and not making direct flight rather zig + zag, back + forth, tonite however it was joined by a 2nd craft about 10 degrees due north of original object, they together displayed the same arradic patterns, almost like signing someone on the ground. odd very odd
content.summary: 2 ufo flying in erratic patterns.

content.detailedDescription:
Approximately 7pm, just after sundown but still light outside i noticed a bright orange light heading in our direction.
it was traveling in a north to south direction coming from the santa cruz side of bay towards monterey/seaside side of bay.
at first i assumed it to be an inbound craft heading to the monterey airport as usual.
the color and was a bright orange color however and seemed to be a blurry sphere shape. nothing like the light from inbound craft - ever.
as we live under a traffic pattern for the monterey airport i kept watching it and straining to see nav lights flashing.
there weren't any.
as a side note; i used to fly, my father was a pilot and my older sibling as well. 
i've been watching planes fly in this area since i was little.
i just expected this one to eventually look like all the others. it never did.

at that point all of us began asking what it was as the flight characteristics were strange.
speed was hard to determine because the approach was coming straight towards us and it didn't hold a straight line. it wavered a bit a couple times and seemed to speed up and slow down a bit?

estimated height appeared to be between three and four thousand feet but since craft size and true speed was undetermined that figure could be off mainly due to lack of experience witnessing anything of this nature before.
there was a twin engine plane circling the area at the same time and that craft appeared to be flying at about 12 to 1500 ft and the orange sphere appeared to be at least three to four times higher altitude.

after watching it's approach just over the coastline it began an accent. 
the ascent didn't seem rapid but gradual. 
towards end of assent it appeared to be going nearly vertical.
as it did, the light grew dim quickly. 
i'd estimate about five to eight seconds then nothing.

the sky was still a bit light and had there been a typical craft there we'd have seen the silhouette against dusk sky even without nav lights. there was nothing to see however.

as for the shape the best we could determine was sphere shaped.
it seemed blurry as well.

sadly, i have to add the following to this sighting to keep things open and balanced?
the sighting was made on the fourth of july. private fireworks are permitted in this area.
some fireworks were already beginning to appear at this early time of evening.
the fireworks of even the "illegal" variety only travel up a couple hundred feet at most over the houses in the immediate block where we live .
they only last mere seconds.
the light in question traveled horizontally long enough for me stare, ponder over it and ask questions to the family about it.
have them all turn to focus on it and to run inside to fetch a camera. the light during assent wasn't strong enough to show up however.

finally - this object made no sound. as it ascended a commercial jet much higher up going south to north was seen and could be heard.
we see those and military over this area all the time.

perhaps they came to see the fireworks?
our first ever ufo sighting!

jim p.
content.summary: Bright orange sphere traveling over monterey bay. first ufo sighting!

content.detailedDescription:
While shooting fireworks at our home, we noticed a light moving slowly in the sky - no anti collision lights - pictures and video were taken and will be added - the event lasted about 3 minutes, and it was not a firework. two of the adults are ex-military and very familiar with military craft. they both stated that what we were watching was not a plane or helicopter or any other conventional craft. the object moved slowly, with slow pulsing strobe of bright gold that would light the center of it. it was about three miles away and very beautiful. it seemed that the center was darker than the rest of the ship, and as it traveled, it went from a reddish color to an orange - the object appeared to be lit from inside - like a frosted glass shade on a lamp. there were 12 adults, most of us non-drinkers, and we had been watching fireworks in the distance and were alerted by the fact unlike the fireworks that had been going on all around the neighborhood, this object was moving horizontaly, did not explode, made no sound, and made a slow arc towards the west before it got so far away we could not see it. the flashing and the lack of anticollision lights as well as the shape and color set this craft apart from any of the aircraft we have ever seen. two of us noticed it at the same time and called out for the others to look and to stop setting off fireworks. we all stood in amazement, confusion, amazement, and fear -a few of us we excited and almost euphoric - feeling lucky to see it. we all discussed the object as it flew in the sky, ruling out every flying craft we could think of as we watched it. we lost sight of it when it flew out of sight.

the pictures are on a camera that belongs to one of the people that saw this event and will send them to me tomorrow. i will send them to you when i get them.

i will gladly share the names and emails/phone numbers of all who saw this craft as they have all agreed.
content.summary: Red/orange glowing rounded craft flying in the sky to the southwest and watched by 12 adults.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting outside at a friend's house waiting for the city fireworks to begin.  the location was about half a mile west of a major interstate, in a country setting. there were approximately 20 people outside at the same time at this particular house. someone pointed an object out in the sky, to the south west of us.  at first we thought it was a plane due to the speed it was traveling and where it was located in the sky.(there is a small city airport nearby, and a larger airport in a city northwest of this area) if it had been a large airliner, we should have been able to see details of it, as it wasn't all that high in the sky, but we couldn't. almost at once, everyone realized it was quite bright, an orangish color, and looked like it had flames, or some kind of glare shooting out or off of the top, but it also appeared to be glowing.  at first i thought, oh no, this is a plane on fire and i thought it was looking for a place to land or it might crash but then i thought, well, this plane doesn't act like it's in trouble.  there wasn't any erratic movements, it just continued flying smoothly.  it seemed to be traveling south to north but as it passed by to the west of us, we were still unable to make out any distinguishing features.  at no point did it lose any altitude. we did not have any sun glare in our eyes as it was cloudy/overcast, we just couldn't see anything except the glare/brightness of the object.  the object continued to move north and then seemed to turn somewhat west and gain altitude, as it appeared to be stationary in the sky, but was getting smaller.  it looked like it was moving up and away from us.  we watched until we could no longer see anything at all.  (a second group of people next door appeared to be watching the object as well) i should also mention, that at no time, could we hear any noise during this whole event. i took one picture with my cell phone.  now, i don't know what to think it was. i do believe that there are other life forms we don't know about yet, but did this have anything to do with that?  i have no idea.

the attachment was taken with a samsung sch-u340 phone with a vga-camera.  the resolution was 320x240, the white balance was "cloudy", the quality was "fine", the color effects were "normal".  if you can open it, and then enlarge it, you will see what looks like a star with a reddish glow coming off the upper left corner.  it also appears to have some sort of heat signature emitting from the entire surface, all of the way around it.
content.summary: Fireball type object moving north west witnessed by a group of people.

content.detailedDescription: A round circle like a plane lite came from a star and went south for about 2 seconds and then shoot of in to space and slowly disapeared straight up we were sitting on the patio and i suddenly looked up and seen it. i told my sister usely planes go south and north but this light was going east and i told my sister dont planes usually go north and south not west, but this light went west and slowly disappeared in to the space i know it was not normal it was not a plane, i was sirprizes because i always heard people talk about sighting but i never seen it for my self but this time i seen it for my self. it disapeared in to space.
content.summary: A round circle shoot south and shoot to space.

content.detailedDescription:
When taking out the trash, i looked up at the night sky and saw 2 orange glowing lights to the southwest barely over long island sound. there was no noise, except for many fireworks, and i thought they were heading south toward long island but they were already a good distance away and it was hard to judge their direction as they disappeared behind cloud cover.

later, neighbors that were at the beach down the street told me that they saw at least 3 lights at one time close together and it seemed there were more scattered around a large area of the sky that were not always visible. they also thought the lights were heading west along the coast.

no one, including myself, thought they were going very fast.

i'm not convinced that it wasn't a group of balloonists, but i can't imagine that many balloonists fly at night. in addition, there seems to be similar reports later the same night to the west in pa.
content.summary: Glowing orange lights following ct shore toward the west.

content.detailedDescription: We were watching the july 4th fireworks and to the east we noticed five, then four, red lights in the sky.  they were in sort of a triangle formation.  the lights were steady in the sky, not moving.  they were red like planets.  there were no other colors or blinking lights.  they appeared to be at the same level as the stars.  they didn't get closer or further away, but disappeared after about twenty minutes.
content.summary: 5 red lights hovering in the sky over spring valley, ca.

content.detailedDescription: At 9:50pm after watching fireworks, me, my wife and child were headed home northbound on hwy 97 in sand springs, ok (near tulsa)passing near shell creek rd.  we saw what at first we assumed was a firework in the sky.  it was orange in color and had no discernible shape, just an orange light in the sky. it was not a firework.  it stayed at what appeared to be a constant altitude and crossed the road we were on, made a small "s" curve and disappeared into a cloud bank.  the sighting lasted for what we assume was about 1 minute.  it never changed intensity nor shape or size.  there were no other colors or lights on it, just an orange, or yellowish orange light or possible sphere?  there was lightning in the sky and as i have never seen ball lightning, i cannot rule this out, but this did not seem like any kind of lightning or "plasma" and appeared to be an orange light on a straight course until it made an abrupt "s" curve and then continued on the same basic heading right into a cloud and was lost from our vision.  my wife and i both said out loud, "that is not a plane or helicopter...That"s a ufo!".  it was approximately about the size of a bb held at arms length.
content.summary: Orange light moved across the sky, made an "s" curve and into clouds.

content.detailedDescription: I was in my backyard for what reason i am not sure, but i look up in the sky and see a obal. i have seen this ufo before. it was not trying to conceal itself very well do to the fact it was bright orange and flickering! it was traveling west towards kokomo high. it was slowing down stopping frequently and speeding up. i would have to say the slowest it was going at one point was 20mph about 1000ft. if anyone else saw this please contact me @ 271-1833.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Obal traveling west slowing stopping.

content.detailedDescription: Looking notheast up valley at fireworks saw light coming orange. thought to be an airplane. heard no sound. object continued south, turned east. next object came a few min. later [ 10? ] same path. followed by another in distance. ran in house for binoculars. sited and focused on third object. it rose in altitude east, and accelerated in speed out of site. fourth object came over mtn. in north, heading southeast. got good look at this as it came closer. than object increased in altitude, and traveled southwest i'm guessing. it went up and out of site. followed a satelite and could still see that, behind slight cloud. surmised cloud did not block view of fourth object. it looked like the shape of a hot air balloon. wind was moving toward east. it did not follow wind, nor could balloon have that much speed. really cool! better than any fireworks! the first 3 seemed a bit yellow at times with the naked eye. an exiting thing to see, but you can't share that!
content.summary: Orange glowing brighter at bottom, not unlike illuminated hot air bal.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving home headed east on cr 400s in lafayette in.   upon driving up a hill, my friend noticed a bright orange light in the sky.  we pulled over and watched the object slowly head west and then east.  the object then quickly increased altitude until it was no longer visible.  i was able to get a very poor quality photo on my phone.  

i work in the aviation industry, and this was no sort of conventional aircraft.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Bright orange orb headed west, and then altered trajectory and headed east before increasing altitude out of visual range.

content.detailedDescription: My wife, a family friend an i were outside of our house watching fireworks when we noticed a light in the sky and thought that it was a burning firework ember or low flying plane. we did not hear any engines so we ruled out a plane.  we watched it move across the sky where it appeared to be rotating, and it would speed up and slow down. at one point it did an abrubt 45 degree turn and then continued on a rather straight line.  it appeared to be getting brighter and then dimmer.  it was very bright then it just dissapeard.  we then noticed it coming from another direction doing the same thing. i used binoculars to view the object, and every time i got a stable view, it seemed to either change coarse or speed up and disappear. at that point my wife captured the light on video with our camcorder.  in the video it went from bring close to us, to being extremely far away with in 10 seconds.  it was also moving at a very steady speed, then faded in and out and was gone.
content.summary: Orange light in sky making direction change, speed changes and hovering above ellwood city.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside cleaning up after a 4th of july party. i bright orange glow went by, above it was a glowing ring. my son (age 6) said it was a "flying mushroom". my neighbors kids (age 5-8, three of them) said it was a "ballon". the object was moving roughly east to west. it went directly across the sky. i knew it was too fast for a helicopter, not too fast for a jet though. i knew it was not anything i had ever seen before. i called it in to the local police. i was curious to see if any one else had called it in. there were a lot of fireworks in the area, many people must have been looking up. this object traveled across the sky, not up or down. it looked the size of a us quarter. i lost sight of the object when trees blocked my view.
content.summary: Bright orange object with a mushroom shaped glow coming off the top moving west to east.

content.detailedDescription:
We were driving home after our local fireworks display. i looked to the northeast of our vehicle and saw what looked like light rising into the air. after a little while it became obvious that they weren't rising, but moving. there were about 15-20 lights in the sky flying in a loose formation from north to south. there was a main group and a smaller group further behind of about 5 lights. many people were pulling over to view the lights. one woman in the car next to us asked us what they were.

i kept thinking that they were most likely aircraft. but they were flying low in a very loose formation with bright lights on, which seemed odd to me. it is certainly something i've never seen before.

we lost sight of the lights when they continued south and were too far away to continue viewing.
content.summary: Lights in sky flying in formation.

content.detailedDescription:
I was pulling into a parking lot in milwaukie, oregon which is a suburb of portland. i had noticed a shiny dot in the sky and thought it was probably a plane which would not be unusual because that is where their incoming flight pattern is. i kept my eye on it as i was pulling into my parking spot and i noticed that it did not move like i had expected it to. i began to think at this point that it might be a ufo. i parked my car quickly and ran out to where i thought i could get a better view and it was gone. 

in may of 2008 i had witnessed a similar sphere and a photo of it appeared on the ufo casebook website. so this time i was more aware of what i may have witnessed.
content.summary: Sphere in the sw sky near portland, oregon!

content.detailedDescription:
It was my brothers birthday a couple of days ago so we chucked him a party yesterday and there were about 30 there and my brother and 3 of his friends went outside because one of my brothers friends were drunk so they waited outside to get a taxi to come and while they did i came outside to and im under 18 and i didn't drink when i saw this light bit bigger than a pea in a yellow/white colour fall from about tree top hight and i watched it for about 3 seconds until it went behind houses at 8:23pm , it could of been a shooting star, comet or something but if it was in the atmosphere which i think cause it looked really close about 15 houses away this thing could of landed but that makes me think it could of been a cracker or firework but i didn't hear and noise or nothing but i don't have a clue what it is. 
thanks.
content.summary: Big yellow light falls.

content.detailedDescription: Air show at margate kent uk. did not see these objects with my own eyes. only noticed after when studying photos. at first thought that they may be birds as this show was on the sea front. but once studied a bit closer i am not sure what they are. someone suggested dirt on the lense, but i do not think so as i always clean it.
content.summary: As photos show.

content.detailedDescription: On june 27, 2009, i was photographing with my digital camera, a sunset in a series of approximately seven photos. i saw nothing with the naked eye until i put the photos on the computer and one photo in the middle showed a strange saucer-like thing in the upper left corner. we were traveling west on co. rt 470 and the object appeared directly to the west and the photo said it was snapped at 6:50 pm on 7/27/09.
content.summary: Photographing sunsets  in a series of pictures; saw nothing until put the pictures on computer.

content.detailedDescription:
While playing basketball in my back yard i noticed a black dot thing flying west toward lookout mountain.  it was windy that day with thunder storms. this object had no lights and remained on the same course at the same speed heading into the wind.  it appeared to be small. like the size of a car maybe.  it was black or black grey. after i watched it for a while i pointed it out to my friend but he couldn't see it lol..  so i called my roommate out and he spotted it quickly and was puzzled about its identity. i think it was about 5000 ft up and moving at about 300mph.  this is all a guess unfortunately. it moved across the sky about the same speed as a satellite in the night sky, but it was day and very low.  it didn't look arrow dynamic. more like a boulder floating by and disappearing. ive been camping and working a lot or i would have file this sooner.  any other reports of this?

regards,
robert l richardson
content.summary: While playing basketball in my back yard i noticed a black dot like thing flying west toward lookout mountain. it was windy that day and this object had no lights and was on the same course at the same speed heading into the wind. it appeared to be small.

content.detailedDescription: Was halfway home going south on hwy52  coming from just seeing judas priest at the "the taste of mn" as i driving along i could clearly see passenger jets lined up to make their landings of to the west you know how you see one giant headlight. well of to the east heading north parallel to the highway at my quess 500-600ft looked like two headlights flying pretty slow then as came more off to the side of it it looked like the typical sightings of the triangle sort three white lights at the corners then one red strobing in the middle [bottom] its dark and i have my wife and three of my five kids with me so i didnt keep trying to see any more of it as i was going by. i could not for the love of god see it as anything ,but triangle shaped did not look like a plane at all. i only noticed because i was driving towards it and it was cloud cover and it was easy to notice the lights cuase it seemed so low. like i said we were going in opposite dirctions so it was basically on course nothing eratic it was all about 15 sec. my feeling was that i wished i could turn around to do some more inspection.
content.summary: Noticed triangle shape craft heading north following hwy 52 towards st. paul.

content.detailedDescription: I was going for a night time walk and i usually look up at the stars on clear nights. this night, something caught my attention steaking across the sky. it was approx about 3 miles away and very high up in the air. i noticed the object was zig zagging up and down and accelerating at a high rate of speed. it didnt seem to be in any type of order or pattern. i grabbed my cell phone that has a 1.3 megapixal camera. the object was 2 light conjoined on one object. i have enclosed 2 pics of 2 different objects on 2 different nights that very similar but were moving in different fashions 3 months apart.
content.summary: 2 bright lights moving in an usual fashion.

content.detailedDescription:
My son and i were heading south on i - 35 freeway just outside of gainesville, texas on the border with oklahoma at about 80 mph near 11pm july 2, 2009.  ahead of us, we suddenly saw a very bright slowly pulsing white light.  it was only about 2 times higher than a freight truck ahead of us - 10 degrees off horizon.  it was blinking very slowly but rhythmically.  the light was a very large, extremely white and extremely bright single source white light.  i would say the source of it as it blinked looked larger than 50' feet across.  it was only a few hundred feet off the ground.  no other little lights anywhere near it was observed. no other obvious airplane type wing tip lights were observed. the light source was so bright that we cannot see what generated it or what was behind the light source.  whenever it blinked, it looked like a giant starburst of pure white light and it looked to be just flashing rhythmically.  it did not change colors while it blinked along. the speed of it was quite slow as it moved along the freeway. i'd say no faster than 100mph.

as we moved south on the freeway, the light slowly came closer and closer to us and finally it flew past us going northerly.  its altitude was at best 500 feet.   however, as it passed overhead, i opened the car window and could not see anything behind it and did not hear any noise beyond wind noise from the highway.  certainly, there were no helicopter blade noise nor were there engine noise.  it is highly doubtful at a mere few hundred feet that a normal single engine or other type of airplane engine noise would not be heard.

it continued north after passing the car.  there were trucks and cars on the road at the time.  nobody stopped.  the incident lasted about 20-25 seconds from beginning to the point where it we cannot see it in the rear view mirror after it went northerly and passed us going southerly on the freeway.

it doesn't look anything like a helicopter, single engine or any kind of jet plane.  it did not make any noise.  the white flashes were very large and extremely long.  it also held the white light much longer than a blinking flash would normally hold.  i'd say when it "pulsed", the bright light source was on for at least half a second to 1.5 seconds each time . then, it would be dark for about 1 second or less and it would blink again. the pulse itself looked at a distance to be wider than 50 feet.  certainly it did not look like a bulb or a wing tip light.
content.summary: Extremely bright single source pulsing white light moving slowly over the freeway.

content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i were watching the weather changes as the storms surrounding us were dying out. i was looking towards the south east i then panned towards the south and within an instant 2 cylinder/orbs appeared directly over our house. they then began streaking away to the west. no sooner that set disappeared in the horizon, another cylinder/orb appeared out of no where in the same location. my girlfriend was now also keyed in on what was happening and could not believe this other cylinder appeared out of thin air and began moving towards the west. we were both quite amazed at what we were seeing. as soon as the other cylinder/orb disappeared on the horizon, one more appeared directly above us. both of us were just baffled that this was actually happening. i then ran inside to get my camcorder. when i came back outside aprox 10 seconds later it was also disappearing out of site on the western horizon. 
recently we've had several weather balloons make appearances as part of a joint nasa - univ of mexico project. i saw those weather balloons and this was nothing even remotely close to that.
these objects were completely silent and incredibly fast. we often also have air force jets from nellis often training above us and refueling almost nightly, so i'm well accustomed to what they look and sound like. these were not a jets, they were way too fast to be jets. 
i have personally known about ufo's in our airspace since 1992 on a professional level. i worked in the national security agency from 1991 to 1995. this is only the second time i've witnessed a sighting in real time.
it was truly amazing.
content.summary: 4 cylinder/orbs appear in the sky directly above us and fly away incredibly fast.

content.detailedDescription:
I was awakened by my dog who wanted to go out at approximately 4:25 am.  i let the dog out and went and got some water.  after a few minutes when the dog hadn't returned i stepped to the front door and called his name.  i turned and put on my shoes and stepped out onto my front porch to call for the dog.  as i did, i noticed small, round white lights in the woods surrounding my home. *i live in a fairly heavily wooded area of five acres* these were multiple, white lights that numbered probably 20 or more.  i initially thought they were flashlights but i realized some of the lights were high and others lower to the ground.  at this time i became aware that the lights were moving towards me and i felt a little frightened.  the dog came around the house and i told him to hurry.  the lights were still moving towards me and becoming closer.  my dog saw the lights and stopped and looked towards them.  i urged him to come and i hurried us into the house, closing the storm door behind me.  i turned back to the door and  some of the lights were quite close to me and the door.  one went right over where i would have been standing and i realized a breeze had come up and that some drops of fluid appeared on the glass of the door.  i couldn't figure out what i was seeing and even though it was odd and scary i couldn't move away from the door and continued to watch these round, white lights.  there seemed to be a pattern to them, almost an ebb and flow.  i changed my position slightly and saw deeper into the woods a fairly large red light.  i thought it was a police car at first and then realized the red light was not blinking like the lights of a police car.  i then heard brakes and towards the highway i saw a car come to a quick stop and i think whoever was in the car was seeing the same thing i was.  *which was a big relief!*  after several minutes the car on the highway pulled away.  i wanted to see the red light closer and so i grabbed my car keys and ran to my car and drove down  the end of my driveway. once i was at the end of the drive i realized that i couldn't see the red light any longer.  i looked up towards the sky and saw a large, brilliant white light.  at this point, i drove back to my house and was able to see a few of the smaller white lights that seemed to still float around the woods.  the smaller white lights seemed to be approximately the size of a baseball an smaller.  they were not identical in size.  
this experience lasted approximately 20 to 25 minutes.  i'm fairly sure of the duration as i was texting my sons who were gone for the week-end, telling them what i was seeing.  i wish i had thought to take a picture but i was so freaked out by what i was seeing that all i could manage to do was watch.
content.summary: Unusual lights and objects.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside playing basketball with my cousin when he pointed out a hovering disk-shaped object in the sky.I thought it was a plane at first but it was just hovering in the same spot  for about a minute. then it started to slowly hover away into the distance .A few minutes later it stoped then quickly accelerated away.
content.summary: Disc shaped object

content.detailedDescription:
i was out snapping photos of the house. went in to upload photos on the computer and there i seen a strange object in one of the photos.

 i zoomed in on the object and it seems to be in the color of silver and saucer shaped. it had to be moving at a fast speed to cause the blur effect that is followed behind it.

 when outside snapping photos i did'nt see anything or hear anything at all.

 the object had to be at a good half mile if not more, away in the north east direction. maybe 500 feet in the sky, if not a little more.

 the object seems to be above south 52 highway.

 weather: cloudy
content.summary: Silver, saucer shaped moving at a fast speed.

content.detailedDescription: We were going home.Hwy 80 east,2 miles or so from shreveport.I thought "thats a odd water tower?"we stopped.Got out .So did other drivers.Silentlyjust above trees very large black triangle with 3 lights at the corners and one red light offcenter from the middle.The red light was blinking.The triangle slowly "slid whileturning" like it was on ice.It drifted then flew away at high speed.We were only 2 or 3 hundred feet away at the time.Across the street 200 feet or so isbarksdale afb.Also 10 years later same section of road,a flaming"ball" went across sky in same direction .I called police fire forest services'all went un noticed there are signs requesting to report fires or odd behavior because of the air basei never reported the triangle.   one more thing  it was day light and in a populated area.
content.summary: Triangle floating.
